Package sample.controller

Class UserDashboardController

java.lang.Object
sample.controller.UserDashboardController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class UserDashboardController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Controls the main user interface form. Provides a controller for the main user interface as well as the additional reports and schedule.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle rb)
      Sets table views and their respective columns for the main user interface.

      Lambda Expression

      The contactSelector combo box requires a lambda expression to take the incoming cell and override the updateItem method. This allows the display of the contact's name while also enabling the identification of the contact via their id.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - the URL object passed in from the background
      rb - the resource bundle passed in from the background

    • formatDateCol

      public void formatDateCol(javafx.scene.control.TableColumn col)
      Allows the formatting of the date column in the appointments table to display in standard date and 12-hour time format.

      Lambda Expression

      A lambda expression is used in the column's setCellFactory method. This allows the incoming cell to be formatted from standard LocalDateTime format to a more user-friendly 12-hour format. (Example: 12/3/2022 6:06 PM)
      Parameters:
      col - the LocalDateTime column for which to set the cell factory

    • populateCustomers

      public void populateCustomers() throws SQLException
      Populates the body of customer in static resources within Schedule.

      Reads the MySQL database for customer records and creates a Customer object for each available customer in the database to be displayed in the user interface.

      Throws:
      SQLException

    • populateAppointments

      public void populateAppointments() throws SQLException
      Populates the body of appointments in static resources within Schedule. Reads the MySQL database for appointment records and creates an Appointment object for each available appointment in the database to be displayed in the user interface.
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • seeAllAppointments

      public void seeAllAppointments()
      Allows the user to see all existing appointments in the user interface. Removes all filters from the appointments table that may have been set by the user via radio button selection.

    • seeWeeklyAppointments

      public void seeWeeklyAppointments()
      Filters appointments by the current week.

      Lambda Expression

      This method uses two lambda expressions:
      • a Stream of type Appointment is filtered to match those that are in the current week
      • each Appointment object in the stream is added to the appoinmentsContainer to effectively filter display

    • seeMonthlyAppointments

      public void seeMonthlyAppointments()
      Filters appointments by the current month.

      Lambda Expression

      This method uses two lambda expressions:
      • a Stream of type Appointment is filtered to match those that are in the current week
      • each Appointment object in the stream is added to the appointmentsContainer to effectively filter display

    • seeContactSchedule

      public void seeContactSchedule(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Filters the appointments for a selected contact in the "Reports" tab.

      Lambda Expression

      • a Stream of type Appointment is filtered to match those associated with the selected contact
      • each Appointment object in the stream is added to the scheduleContainer to effectively filter the schedule display
      Parameters:
      event - the event triggered by user interaction with interface components

    • updateAppointment

      public void updateAppointment(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Triggers the initialization of the appointment update form. The method loads the currently selected appointment into the impending appointment update form. If there is no selection, the method will trigger a notification.
      Parameters:
      event - the event triggered via user interaction with interface components
      Throws:
      IOException
      See Also:
      • Notification.noSelection(String, String)

    • addAppointment

      public void addAppointment(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Activates the form for adding appointments.
      Parameters:
      event - the event triggered by user interaction with UI elements
      Throws:
      IOException

    • deleteAppointment

      public void deleteAppointment(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException, SQLException
      Removes a selected appointment from the database. Also performs a selection check to ensure an appointment is selected.
      Parameters:
      event - the event triggered by user interaction with UI elements
      Throws:
      IOException
      SQLException

    • addCustomer

      public void addCustomer(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Triggers the form for adding a new customer.
      Parameters:

      Throws:

    • updateCustomer

      public void updateCustomer(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Allow the addition of a new customer to the database. Ensures a customer is selected and passed to the customer update controller before triggering the form.
      Parameters:
      event - the event triggered by user interaction with UI elements
      Throws:
      IOException

    • deleteCustomer

      public void deleteCustomer() throws SQLException
      Removes a customer from the database. Ensures a customer is selected before any deletions are made.

      Lambda Expression

      A lambda expression is used here to check for a customers existing appointments via customer id. The resulting list created by filtering user appointments is counted to determine existing appointments.
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • populateMonthTypeTable

      public void populateMonthTypeTable(javafx.collections.ObservableList<MonthTypeRecord> reportContainer, String query) throws SQLException
      Fills in the report containing appointments by month and type. Creates ReportItem records to fill a TableView.
      Parameters:
      reportContainer - an ObservableList object where the records will be stored
      query - the SQL query to run against the database to retrieve necessary records
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • populateCountryTable

      public void populateCountryTable(javafx.collections.ObservableList<CountryRecord> reportContainer, String query) throws SQLException
      Fills in the report containing the amount of customers by country. Creates ReportItem records to fill a TableView.
      Parameters:
      reportContainer - an ObservableList object where the records will be stored
      query - the SQL query to run against the database to retrieve the necessary records.
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • refreshReports

      public void refreshReports() throws SQLException
      Refreshes the data contained in the "Reports" pane. Sends prepared SQL queries to population methods.
      Throws:
      SQLException
      See Also:
